alert.note: Alert for Pierce; St. Croix (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:04PM CDT until May 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Carver, Sibley and Scott Counties. Crow River at Rockford affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Red Wing affecting Pierce and Goodhue Counties. Mississippi River at Hwy 610 in Brooklyn Park affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. St Croix River at Stillwater affecting Washington, St. Croix and Pierce Counties. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Carver, Dakota and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River at New Ulm affecting Nicollet, Brown and Blue Earth Counties. Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Renville, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Minnesota River at Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. South Fork Crow River at Delano affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Mississippi River at Red Wing L/D 3 affecting Pierce, Goodhue and Dakota Counties. Mississippi River at St. Paul affecting Ramsey, Dakota and Washington Counties. Mississippi River near Hastings L/D 2 (COE) affecting Washington, Goodhue, Dakota and Pierce Counties. .Rivers have crested and are falling. The light precipitation expected this weekend should have little or no impact on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Croix River at Stillwater. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 86.8 feet, Buckeye Street Garage in Hudson impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 87.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Friday was 88.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday morning and continue falling to 86.3 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 87.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 87.9 feet on 06/28/1993. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
